item.description: mind. mouth. menu. Designer / Project Exploration / 2018 Mind. Mouth. Menu. is an app which places focus on finding recipes given a dietary need such as diabetes, weight loss, celiac and so on. The app design focuses on being clean and minimal, with simple focused iconography to increase user intuition. The app uses contrasting colours to maintain a sense of energy, whilst having a neutral white and grey colour throughout.

item.title: Museum of Writing
item.description: Responsive Website Design Here we show the responsive mobile version of the newly designed site. 01 Colour 02 Type 03 Graphics

item.title: PyData
item.description: PyData London Organiser, Co-Chair 2017 and Designer / PyData London / 2017 PyData London is the largest Data Science group in the UK. PyData is the educational program of Numfocus, and is a global charity that aims to raise money to assist open source libraries. Here I ran meetups for 4 years and with the team we grew the community to 9k members. We focus on how Python is being used within Data Science.

item.title: T.S.Eliot
item.description: The Ghost of T.S.Eliot Artist + Data Scientist / School for Poetic Computation / 2017 The Ghost of T.S.Eliot questions whether we should allow artists and people to live on after death. T.S.Eliot is himself, one of the profound poets whom has ever lived, producing works such as The Wasteland (1922), Four Quartets (1943) and The Love Song of J. Alfred Prufrock (1915), his most widely known work.

item.title: Keys to Good Data Science
item.description: I’ve been working as a Data Scientist for a few years now, so I’ve decided to share what I think is key to good data science. A lot of the advice is applicable to other areas, so there’s cross over in other roles. Also you may disagree with some of it! Am always happy to discuss it, so drop me an email if you think otherwise. I may even evolve and develop these thoughts as time goes on!

item.title: Time Thoughts
item.description: Time is an odd quantity, many of us wishing we had more of it, or wanting it to hurry up for some pivotal event in our lives. We know time, in terms of past, present and future. Being able to recall dates of significant events, what we are doing at this very moment as well as planning future milestones, holidays or celebrations. We lead ourselves into a sense time is linear and global.

item.title: School for Poetic Computation
item.description: Over the past few weeks, I have moved my life back to NY to attend SFPC. For those of you who may not have heard about SFPC before, its a school for the intersection of art and technology and is a hybrid of a school, residency and research group. Anyway here are some initial thoughts about what I want SFPC to be and what I plan to do! What I want for SFPC to be?
